entries.meaning: Failure to promote a person to a higher rank.
examples: It is true that there are men to be found who never rise beyond a curacy; as there are grey-headed midshipmen occasionally to be seen in the navy. But the former case is quite as rare as the latter; promotion is the rule, non-promotion the exception, in both professions.

entries.meaning: (US, education) The holding back of a pupil instead of advancing them to the next year of studies.
examples: The first group consisted of the Black teachers who expressed ambivalence and concern that students would be emotionally hurt by nonpromotions. The second group consisted of gregarious, highly spirited teachers.
